{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3425360,"name":"Joe Schmo","username":"GenericUserPerson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-19T20:42:58.343Z","cooked":"

Introducing the Universal Parts Library! These are a bunch of configurable parts and assemblies I made in my spare time, piggybacking VERY heavily off of MKCad, so thanks to the MKCad team for making this stuff and really inspiring to do all this. Mostly looking for any feedback, but feel free to use any of this!
https://cad.onshape.com/documents/1c7c96c53e8d3b28ebea53f4/w/c7d325f82fb4980d72ad282b/e/fe54fdcf71f085934adff927
Guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/11DQ3uVNwpeVOjq0CcXkcmAp79eoVtb9spu9yOwdgsAY/edit?usp=sharing

This is sweet. Let me know if you’d like to add our AndyMark Climber CAD into the library. It was outside the scope of MKCad, but it looks like what you’re trying to do is more in line with this model. I’m available to assist.

I think it would be convenient to have a “top-mount” bellypan option for the Universal Swerve Drivebase, seeing as a lot of teams mount it above the frame rails so they can leave the electronics exposed for easy access from underneath.

FYI, Front Bumper Offset breaks on one side.

image806×647 97.4 KB

Oh, oops. I’ll look into that and fix it.
EDIT: It should be fixed, now.
Would you mind if I made a copy of the climber and credited you? There’s a few things I’d be looking to add like the option to use slider mates instead of predefined positions.

My post got kinda buried, but the Robot Manager app does now support direct insertion of both Andymark Climber in a Box as well as The Thrify Bot’s Telescoping tubes.

New Robot Manager Onshape App Update Onshape
Hello all, I’ve just pushed a new update to my Robot Manager Onshape app which adds a handful of new features as well as some minor QoL improvements. Background The main use case for Robot Manager currently is to link documents together and push and pull versions automatically between them. This is mainly useful for teams which split their robots across multiple documents, as Robot Manager makes it much easier to propagate changes from document to document. Copy Design Robot Manager now suppo…

The design is actually based on @kitare102’s model, although I did remodel things in order to add slider mates and remove the configurations (which aren’t’t necessary thanks to direct insertion).

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-09-21T00:13:12.634Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471497,"topic_slug":"universal-parts-library","display_username":"Alex Kempen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/new-robot-manager-onshape-app-update/471452","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"New Robot Manager Onshape App Update","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58757,"username":"GenericUserPerson","name":"Joe Schmo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/13edae/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40591,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Design Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/universal-parts-library/471497/5","custom_user_title":"Design Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3426395,"name":"Eric Bergquist","username":"kitare102","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kitare102/{size}/212327_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-23T16:08:57.930Z","cooked":"

Absolutely! Slider mates do make sense for testing mid-positions, I think I didn’t include them because I was tired and didn’t want to do the math required to make sure they worked correctly no matter the tube length. If @VenomousFire has a better starting point for your implementation, definitely copy that and include them in the credit.

Side note: I’m guessing performance would be improved if someone modeled all of the AndyMark parts in Onshape so that they can be rendered natively instead of through the STEP conversion. Another thing I didn’t do because lazy.
